Overview:
       

The risks associated with a pandemic influenza outbreak have many utility companies across North America developing business continuity plans (BCP) focused on the nuances of an influenza pandemic. The goal of most of these plans is preservation of employee well being and maintenance of reliable utility services. A successful plan will begin by developing a cohesive set of policies concerning:


Regulatory & reporting requirements

Prioritization of vaccine for critical electric company functions

Business continuity

Shareholder liability

Human resources management

Management chain of command

Internal and external communications

Supply chain management

Utility operations continuity
The participants on this program have experience in public health, policy making and developing and testing pandemic flu response exercises. Collaboration with peers and competitors allow benchmarks to be made which may serve as the best model for pandemic influenza preparedness.
